docs.lead_paragraph: From announcements about next-generation technology products to speculation about whether the biggest computer virus of the year was actually a big practical joke and mysterious sightings in Google Earth, here is a list of the Top 10 stories on Bits that captured our readers' attention. We were surprised by a couple ourselves.
docs.abstract: From announcements about new iPhones and e-readers to a mysterious apparition in Google Earth, a look back at which blog posts captured readers' attention in 2009.
docs.snippet: From announcements about new iPhones and e-readers to a mysterious apparition in Google Earth, a look back at which blog posts captured readers' attention in 2009....

docs.lead_paragraph: I was accelerating fast out of a 90-degree corner, heading into a double-S turn that led to the short back straightaway. The bulky Mustang GT's V-8 whined -- R.P.M.'s approaching 8,000 -- and at least two tires were screeching as their edges barely held the tarmac. I was hard on the clutch, hard on the brakes, hard on the motor. And that's how my instructors at the Bob Bondurant School of High-Performance Driving wanted it. Because auto racing, done properly, is brutal on a car. To work as a race mechanic is Sisyphean. Professional teams rebuild their engines nearly every weekend, and Bondurant employs a crew of technicians to constantly replace the parts ruined by hacks like me. You might hesitate to run third gear to the redline in your Volvo, but there's little reason to worry at Bondurant. As one instructor put it, while my class coughed inside a cloud of atomized tire rubber, ''You're here to push the limits of the car.''
docs.abstract: Josh Dean Master Class column discusses driving schools that offer experiences behind racecars; photo (M)
docs.snippet: Learning to find the apex of a turn while heel-toe downshifting at high-performance driving school....

docs.lead_paragraph: IN an ideal motoring world, Amnon Shashua acknowledges, there would be no need for the EyeQ chip, a processor that analyzes signals from automobile-mounted cameras to warn drivers of potential collisions or other dangerous situations. ''If you're very vigilant and very alert, you don't need a thing to help you,'' said Dr. Shashua, the chairman and chief scientist of MobilEye, a company based in the Netherlands that produces EyeQ. ''Your visual processing is much better than any computer.''
docs.abstract: What's Next column describes chip-based camera system that analyzes physical data in effort to prevent automotive accidents; truckers may become first to benefit from technology (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: If you have to be a little crazy to be an entrepreneur, going into business with your spouse must represent a special kind of lunacy. My husband, Chris, and I have been business partners for more than six years. In that time we've started two businesses, sold one of them, had two kids and gotten more or less used to the daily roller coaster ride of entrepreneurial life.

headline.main: When Your Spouse Is Your Business Partner

docs.lead_paragraph: The decision is a signal that the company thinks its self-driving technology has moved beyond research project status and is ready for commercialization.
docs.abstract: Google parent company Alphabet announces it will spin off its autonomous car project from its research lab X into stand-alone company named Waymo; move offers sign that company's self-driving technology is ready for commercialization.
